The integer remainder function crashes if the the divisor is zero.
In a sense, this is the same behaviour as Python (Python would raise a ZeroDivisionError) but this stills feels quite unclean. At the moment, the behaviour is to crash.

(This prints `Floating point exception (core dumped)` and crashes the process)

Should I add a test before the method is called so that it can fail cleanly? Or keep the current behaviour?
